channel.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
channel.description: ok im up to the step where now im trying to have my friends test out my client... i downloaded a file with java file deleter, utorrent, and hamachi. i have heard alot about hamachi and no-ip but idk should i stick with hamachi or download no-ip? because my router will be block using no-ip setup thingy that involves adding the server on the router list as i saw on youtube.

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

This thread has to be a joke, sorry to say.
If your parents are that strict then I just wouldn’t be playing

Problems with hosting at school:

  1. It doesn’t make a difference if your teacher lets you do whatever
  2. Your school probably turns their computers and their network off at night
  3. Your school probably has a firewall
  4. Your school probably has shitty computers like mine

If your actually serious then tell your parents that you can make money off hosting a server and follow other instructions that others have given from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @Skillet_001 Skillet 001
item.description:
@Skillet_001 wrote:

Go to portforward.com and follow instructions from there to port forward.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @Liam_Baby Liam Baby
item.description:
@Liam_Baby wrote:

No-ip is a better choice, so people don’t have to download hamachi and then log on. Also use port forwarding instead of utorrent

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @spearo spearo
item.description:
@spearo wrote:

lol I wish you great luck then, since your 13 they might go easy on your if your caught xD.
And tell your dad you wanna play runescape, it is a game for 12+ so your of appropriate age now.
Say: Dad can I start playing runescape again? I promise it wont interfere with my school work + I just wanna hang with my friends. I only talk to friend from my school, not random people(lul). I am 13 and the age requirement is for 12 and under. I promise not to kill myself If i loose a pk battle, I wont spend real money for membership, and I wont start saying stuff like “pwnage” “noob” or “plox” in real life. LOL

That should work xD.

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @spearo spearo
item.description:
@spearo wrote:

  1. Using school computers like that is illegal, plus rsps clients are copy-written material it self lol. 2x illegal.
  2. You need administrator rights on the computer to portforward, so unless you can edit the schools router, no can do.
  3. Good luck lol.

Also whats your msn? I might be interested in helping your project. Pm me.

Read full topic

i tried to download hamachi on my schools computer but it needed admin to apply so i went ahead and sticked with no-ip.
i couldnt find changing my ip and server port on my server.
it is a PI base 317.
can anyone give me the correct route to changing it?[/quote]

Are you trying to host at home or at school?

If you have No-IP, people can just login. Not go through a bunch of processes.

item.title: Hamachi or no-ip?
item.dc:creator: @junkfroggy junkfroggy
item.description:
@junkfroggy wrote:

You need to port forward 43594, or whatever port you’re using for your server.
After that, setup No-Ip and run it on your computer that’s hosting the server.

It should be pickup and be ready for usage.
Also, you can edit it. There’s always a way. Besides, you could always ask permission to add the port.

If your parents say no, stop trying and wait until they think you can start a server.
Your parents know best for you.

Read full topic
